Lobbying Activities: At a presentation of safety course certificates to learners of the NISO Certificate in Safety, Health and Welfare at Work at the Price of Wales Hotel, Athlone, on 16 February 2018, the Minister of State at the Department of Public Expenditure and Reform with special responsibility for the Office of Public Works and Flood Relief was asked to encourage greater participation in the All Ireland Safety Awards by Government Departments, Local Authorities and State organisations.|Event / Reception|1::In a letter dated 19 February 2018, the Minister of State at the Department of Public Expenditure and Reform with special responsibility for the Office of Public Works and Flood Relief was asked to encourage greater participation in the All Ireland Safety Awards by Government Departments, Local Authorities and State organisations.|Letter|1

Specific Details: Flood management in the midlands, flood defenses and contributory factors to flood events,
DPOs Lobbied: Kevin Boxer Moran|Minister of State|The Office of Public Works
Subject Matter: Flood management in the midlands, flood defenses and contributory factors to flood events,
Intended Results: recognition that Ardnacrusha hydro produces the equivalent power to 30x 5 MW  wind power turbines, that if the water was reduced in the months of possible flood effect, Nov, Dec, JAN, Feb and March, 100 million investment in wind power would compensate for loss of power generation by hydro. the result would supply valuable grazing for farmers due to exposed callow lands though out the year.::repatriate a land base from BNM capable of developing 120 MW of wind power, franchise out this project as strategic infrastructure to the highest bidder, If such a project was invested in, wind power excess could be used to either pump water in to reservoirs to elevate flooding or pump water to cities.

Specific Details: DFI supported a grassroots advocacy campaign to get public buildings lit up in purple to mark the international day of persons with disabilities.
DPOs Lobbied: Kevin Boxer Moran|Minister of State|The Office of Public Works::Finian McGrath|Minister of State|Department of Justice and Equality::Caoimhghín Ó Caoláin|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Joan Collins|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::John Dolan|Senator|Seanad::Nial Ring|Councillor|Dublin City Council
Subject Matter: DFI supported a grassroots advocacy campaign to get public buildings lit up in purple to mark the international day of persons with disabilities.
Intended Results: Certain public buildings to light up purple to mark the international day of persons with disabilities.
Lobbying Activities: 1 letter - Sent via post and email to Minister Kevin Boxer Moran from John Dolan requesting that he turn certain public buildings purple, plus two targetted tweets.|Letter|1::1 email and 1 follow up phone call - To Deputy Caoimhghin O'Caolain informing him of the campaign in response to a question from his office on whether anything was being done to mark the international day of persons with disabilities, IDPD.|Email|1
Person primarily responsible for lobbyin: Clare Cronin, Fiona O'Donovan, John Dolan
Grassroots directive: We posted/re-posted approximately 11-20 social media posts inviting people to take a photo of their own buildings and turn it purple with a photo filter to show support for getting buildings lit up in purple. Some tagged DPOs, including: Minister Finian McGrath, Caoimhghin O'Caolain TD, Joan Collins TD, Senator John Dolan, Dublin City Councillors, Mayor of Dublin Nial Ring, Cork County Council.

Specific Details: The meeting discussed the substantial and damaging rises in business insurance premiums and the damage they are doing to small business in Ireland, the urgent need to review retail commissions paid by the National Lottery and the National Lottery License and a follow up on progress towards the creation of a small business ombudsman about which the NFRN have had previous discussions with Mr Moran.
DPOs Lobbied: Kevin 'Boxer' Moran|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas
Subject Matter: The meeting discussed the substantial and damaging rises in business insurance premiums and the damage they are doing to small business in Ireland, the urgent need to review retail commissions paid by the National Lottery and the National Lottery License and a follow up on progress towards the creation of a small business ombudsman about which the NFRN have had previous discussions with Mr Moran.
Intended Results: To engage and inform government and TDs, raising the profile of these issues and the impact on independent retailers and prompt government action to help independent retailers.
Lobbying Activities: The meeting was held at Minister Moran's office and discussed issues involving insurance for retail businesses and the national lottery.  The discussion also followed up on previous work the NFRN has done in calling for the creation of a small business ombudsman,|Meeting|1
